title: Leicester City equal Premier League record win with nine-goal rout over sorry Southampton
text:
Hallowe’en arrived a week early in Southampton, and the nightmares could continue for some time after this debacle as Leicester City recorded the biggest away win in Premier League history.

Any goodwill Ralph Hasenhuttl has accrued is in danger of evaporating completely as their disastrous home form continued. Leicester romped into a 5-0 half-time lead after Ryan Bertrand was sent off in just the 12th minute.

Leicester are up to second place, perhaps dreaming of a repeat of their 2016 title. “Manchester City, we’re coming for you,” their jubilant fans chanted on a night in which both Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy scored hat-tricks.

Friday night’s decisive moment came early on and is one that Southampton, and Bertrand in particular, will be desperate to forget.

The hosts were caught in possession and Leicester worked the ball to Chilwell down the left. The England full-back found Harvey Barnes, whose low shot was parried by Angus Gunn. Chilwell continued his run to convert the rebound.
